sen.j: 八瀬比叡山口駅（やせひえいざんぐちえき）は、京都府京都市左京区にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄叡山本線の終着鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Yase-Hieizanguchi Station is a terminal on the Eizan Main Line, which is operated by Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a terminal on the Eizan Main Line, which is operated by Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a terminal on the Eizan Main Line, which is operated by Eizan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: Eizan dentetsuを削除し、Eizan Electric Railway のみとしました。

sen.j: 駅概要
sen.e: Summary of the station
Summary of the station
Summary of the station

sen.j: 駅名の通り比叡山への西の入口で、ケーブルカー・索道を乗り継いで比叡山山頂に行ける。
sen.e: Being evident from the station name, the peak of Mt.Hiei-zan is reached from this station by using a cable car and other cable means.
As is evident from the station name, the peak of Mt. Hiei-zan is reached from this station by using a cable car and other cable means.
As is evident from the station name, the peak of Mt. Hiei is reached from this station by using a cable car and other cable means.

sen.j: また開業以来、駅名が「八瀬」→「八瀬遊園」→「八瀬比叡山口」と変わっている。
sen.e: Since operation of this station started, its name has been changed from Yase to Yase-yuen (the Yase amusument park) and to Yase-Hieizanguchi (the Yase entrance to Mt.Hiei-zan).
Since this station began operating, its name has been changed from Yase to Yase-yuen (the Yase amusement park) and to Yase-Hieizanguchi (the Yase entrance to Mt. Hiei-zan).
Since this station began operating, its name has been changed from Yase to Yase-yuen (the Yase amusement park) and to Yase-Hieizanguchi (the Yase entrance to Mt. Hiei).

sen.j: 駅前には以前の駅名の由来となった八瀬遊園地の後身である「スポーツバレー京都」→「森のゆうえんち」があったが2001年に閉園となり、翌年に現在の駅名である八瀬比叡山口駅に改称された。
sen.e: In the past, Sports Valley Kyoto, later renamed Mori-no-Yuenchi (amusement park in the forest), after which the station was named before, existed, but the park closed in 2001 and in 2002, the name was changed to the present one, Yase-Hieizanguchi Station.

In the past there was Sports Valley Kyoto, later renamed Mori-no-Yuenchi (amusement park in the forest), after which the station was previously named, but the park closed in 2001 and, in 2002, the name was changed to the present Yase-Hieizanguchi Station.

In the past there was Sports Valley Kyoto, later renamed Mori-no-Yuenchi (amusement park in the forest), after which the station was previously named, but the park closed in 2001 and, in 2002, the name was changed to the present Yase-Hieizanguchi Station.

sen.j: 跡地は現在、大規模な会員制ホテル「エクシブ八瀬離宮」を中心に老人ホームなども立地し、静閑な土地を生かした再開発が行われている（駅から少し北、または南の地区でも住宅開発がされている）。
sen.e: Now, the former park site has been redeveloped by effectively using the quiet nature of the area, centered on the Resourttrust XIV Yase Rikyu membership hotel and with a senior citizen's home having been constructed as well.
The former park site has been redeveloped by make use of the quiet nature of the area, centered on the Resourttrust XIV Yase Rikyu membership hotel and the addition of a home for senior citizens.

The former park site has been redeveloped by making use of the quiet nature of the area, centered on the Resourttrust XIV Yase Rikyu membership hotel and the addition of a home for senior citizens; furthermore, areas slightly north of the station as well as in the south have been developed for residential quarters.
sen.cmt: 文末の翻訳を追加しました。

sen.j: 駅周辺には昔ながらの茶屋が数軒あり、ニシンそばや猪肉など京都らしい食事が出来る。
sen.e: In the area around the station, several traditional-style restaurants exist and you can enjoy there Kyoto-reminding dishes, such as "buckheat noodle with herring" and "wild boar meat."
In the area around the station there are several traditional-style restaurants, and you can enjoy nostalgic Kyoto dishes such as "buckwheat noodle with herring" and "wild boar meat."
In the area around the station there are several traditional-style restaurants, and you can enjoy nostalgic Kyoto dishes such as "buckwheat noodle with herring" and "wild boar meat."

sen.j: 周囲には吊り橋（台座部分の崩落で2007年12月現在撤去中）や木造の橋があり、河原ではバーベキューや写生を楽しむ人も多い。
sen.e: In the area around the station, wooden bridges as well as a suspension bridge (which is now being dismantled because some base portions of the main pillars have collapsed) exist and many pepole enjoy barbecue or sketching on the riverbed field

In the area around the station there are wooden bridges as well as a suspension bridge (which is now being dismantled because some base portions of the main pillars have collapsed), and many people enjoy barbecue or sketching on the riverbed field.

In the area around the station there are wooden bridges as well as a suspension bridge (which is dismantled, as of December 2007, because some base portions of the main pillars have collapsed), and many people enjoy barbecue or sketching on the riverbed field.

sen.j: 平日昼の運転本数が鞍馬線方面電車の方が多い状態になっている（出町柳駅発において、八瀬比叡山口行が毎時3本に対し、鞍馬線方面は二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)折り返しも含めると毎時6本となっている）。
sen.e: In the day time of weekdays, more trains are operated in the direction of the Kurama Line (at Demachiyanagi Station, three trains an hour go for Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, while six trains an hour run in the direction of Kuram Line, including those returning from Niken-chaya Station (located in kyoto Prefecture)).

In the daytime on weekdays, more trains are operated in the direction of the Kurama Line (at Demachiyanagi Station, three trains an hour start out for Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, while six trains an hour run in the direction of the Kuram Line, including those returning from Niken-chaya Station (in Kyoto Prefecture)).

In the daytime on weekdays, more trains are operated in the direction of the Kurama Line (at Demachiyanagi Station, three trains an hour start out for Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, while six trains an hour run in the direction of the Kurama Line, including those returning from Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture)).
sen.cmt: Kurama Line, Nikenchaya としました。

sen.j: 市中心部から大原方面へ向かう場合、この駅でバスに乗り換えることもできるが、京都バスを中心部から直接利用することが多いため（乗り換え利用は運賃面でも不利となる）、この駅でバスに乗り換える人はあまりいない（但し、秋の観光シーズンにおいては、京都市内の道路事情がかなり悪化する事から、これを避ける為の乗り換え利用者もいる）。
sen.e: When going to the Ohara area from the central area of the city, it is possible to use a bus from this station, but many persons use Kyoto buses directly from the central area (the use of a bus from this station is not advantageous in the view of transportation fee either), and therefore, few people use buses from this station (however, in the autumn sight-seeing season, some travellers use buses from this station to avoid the traffic congestion within Kyoto City in the seaon).

When going to the Ohara area from the central area of the city, it's possible to take a bus from this station, but many people use Kyoto buses directly from the central area (the use of a bus from this station isn't advantageous in view of the transportation fee), so few use buses from this station (however, in the autumn sightseeing season some travelers use buses from this station in order to avoid the traffic congestion within Kyoto City).

When going to the Ohara area from the central area of the city, it's possible to take a bus from this station, but many people use Kyoto buses directly from the central area (the use of a bus from this station isn't advantageous in view of the transportation fee), so few use buses from this station (however, in the autumn sightseeing season some travelers use buses from this station in order to avoid the traffic congestion within Kyoto City).

sen.j: ケーブルカー駅は、改札を出てすぐに木橋を渡り、300mほど離れたところにある。
sen.e: The cable car station is located around 300 m apart from this station, across a wooden bridge.
The cable-car station is located approximately 300 meters from this station, across a wooden bridge.
The cable-car station is located approximately 300 meters from this station, after exiting the ticket gate and crossing a wooden bridge.
sen.cmt: 改札を出て を追加しました。

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 開業以来からの木造駅舎と、終着駅に特有のドーム状の屋根がかつての栄光を偲ばせる。
sen.e: The wooden station house used from the start of this station and the dome-like roof specific to a terminal station rmind us of the glorious days in th epast.
The wooden station house used from the start of the station and the dome-like roof specific to a terminal station recall the glorious days of the past.
The wooden station house used from the start of the station and the dome-like roof specific to a terminal station recall the glorious days of the past.

sen.j: 駅は平素は無人だが、多客時のみ係員が配置され、自動改札機（1台設置）や自動券売機も稼働する。
sen.e: The station is unmanned ordinarily, but when many users are expected, station officers are stationed, and an automatic ticket-checking machine and automatic ticket vending machine are operated as well.
The station is normally unmanned, but when many users are expected station officers are stationed, and an automatic ticket-checking machine and automatic ticket vending machine are operated as well.
The station is normally unmanned, but when many users are expected station officers are stationed, and an automatic ticket-checking machine and automatic ticket vending machine are operated as well.

sen.j: ホームは3面2線の頭端式ホーム。
sen.e: Three platforms serving two tracks are provided, with each end of the three platforms connected to generate a spacious plane area.
sen.cmt: ”頭端式ホーム”： 英語訳が見つかりませんので、意訳してあります。
sen.e: Three platforms serving two tracks are provided, with each end of the three platforms connected to generate a spacious expanse.
Three toothed platforms serving two tracks are provided, with each end of the three platforms connected to generate a spacious expanse.

sen.j: 改札口は出町柳駅や鞍馬駅のように頭端部ではなく、頭端部に向って左側の北側にある。
sen.e: The entrance/exit gate is provided not on the generated spacious plane area, as in Demachiyanagi Station and Kurama Station, but on the north side, to the left when facing the generated spacious plane area from the tracks.
The entrance/exit gate is provided not on the aforementioned expanse, as in Demachiyanagi Station and Kurama Station, but on the north side, to the left when facing the expanse from the tracks.
The ticket gate is provided not on the aforementioned expanse, as in Demachiyanagi Station and Kurama Station, but on the north side, to the left when facing the expanse from the tracks.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gateとしました。

sen.j: 頭端部には団体用の臨時出入口があるがほとんど利用されない。
sen.e: A special entrance/exit gate for grouped users is provided on the generated spacious plane area, but is rarely used.
A special entrance/exit gate for groups of users is provided on the expanse, but it's rarely used.
A special entrance/exit gate for groups of users is provided on the expanse, but it's rarely used.

sen.j: 改札口側が1番線ホームで一番南側が2番線ホーム。
sen.e: The platform nearer to the entrance/exit gate is for track 1 and the one on the south side for track 2.
The platform nearer to the entrance/exit gate is for track 1, and the one on the south side is for track 2.
The platform nearer to the entrance/exit gate is for Platform 1, and the one on the southernmost side is for Platform 2.
sen.cmt: Platform としました。Southernmost としました。

sen.j: 中間の細い降車用ホームは2番線側に電車が到着した際に利用されているが、ホーム番号は無い。
sen.e: The narrow intermediate platform, with no track number, is especially for getting-off passengers and is used only when a train arrives at track 2.
The narrow intermediate platform, with no track number, is specifically for passengers leaving trains and is used only when a train arrives at track 2.
The narrow intermediate platform, with no track number, is specifically for passengers leaving trains and is used only when a train arrives at Platform 2.

sen.j: 1番線ホーム側の一番出町柳側にはホームに面してトイレがあるが「乗務員専用」と表示があり、一般客は改札の外側の2番線側にあるトイレを使うことになる。
sen.e: Although a lavatory is located on the Demachiyanagi side of the platform for track 1, the display of "Only for train crew" is given, and general station users must use the lavoratory that is placed outside of the entrance/exit gate and on the track 2 side.

Although a lavatory is located on the Demachiyanagi side of the platform for track 1, the display "Only for train crew" is given, so general station users must use the lavatory located outside the entrance/exit gate and on the track 2 side.

Although a lavatory is located on the Demachiyanagi side of the platform for Platform 1, the display 'Only for train crew' is given, so general station users must use the lavatory located outside the ticket gate and on the Platform 2 side.

sen.j: 乗務員用トイレの隣には、電車折り返し時用の運転手の休憩室がある。
sen.e: A resting room for the crew to be on returning trains is located next to the lavatory for train crew.
A rest area for the crew who will go into service on returning trains is located next to the lavatory for the train crew.
A rest area for the crew who will go into service on returning trains is located next to the lavatory for the train crew.

sen.j: ドーム状の屋根は現在の車両の1両の長さには僅かに足りないが、1番線ホームだけはホーム全体に上屋が延長されている。
sen.e: The length of the dome-like roof is slightly less than that of a present train car, but the roof covers the entire area of platform for track 1 alone.
The length of the dome-like roof is slightly less than that of a present-day train car, but the roof covers the entire area of the platform for track 1 alone.
The length of the dome-like roof is slightly less than that of a present-day train car, but the roof covers the entire area of the platform for Platform 1 alone.

sen.j: 駅前からホームまで平面であり車椅子等での利用は容易。
sen.e: The area from the entrance/exit to the platforms are flat, making use of this station by wheelchair users easy.
The area from the entrance/exit to the platforms is flat, so it's easy for people in wheelchairs to use the station.
The area from the entrance/exit to the platforms is flat, so it's easy for people in wheelchairs to use the station.

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Station surroundings
The station's surroundings
Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道鋼索線 ケーブル八瀬駅...徒歩3分。
sen.e: Cable-Yase Station for the cable car line operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd..
Cable-Yase Station for the cable-car line operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Cable-Yase Station for the cable-car line operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.: Three-minute walk from the station

sen.j: 比叡山へのケーブルカー乗り場。
sen.e: The place to get on a cable car for Mt.Hiei-zan.
This is the place to board a cable car for Mt. Hiei-zan.
This is the place to board a cable car for Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: 九頭竜大社（九頭竜弁財天）
sen.e: Kuzuryu-taisha Shrine (Kuzuryu Benzaiten)
Kuzuryu-taisha Shrine (Kuzuryu Benzaiten)
Kuzuryu-taisha Shrine (Kuzuryu Benzaiten)

sen.j: 喜鶴亭
sen.e: Kikakutei
Kikakutei
Kikakutei (a Japanese-style hotel)
sen.cmt: 旅館のようですので、補足しました。

sen.j: 高野川 (京都市)
sen.e: The Takano-gawa River
The Takano-gawa River
The Takano-gawa River

sen.j: リゾートトラスト八瀬離宮
sen.e: Resourttrust XIV Yase Rikyu
Resourttrust XIV Yase Rikyu
Resourttrust XIV Yase Rikyu

sen.j: バスのりば
sen.e: Bus stops
Bus stops
Bus stops

sen.j: 八瀬比叡山口駅には、現在駅前までバス路線は乗り入れていないが、京阪電鉄が出町柳駅まで延伸した際に、乗継客の増加を予想して改札を出てすぐの八瀬遊園前に大原行きのバスターミナルが整備され、大原との間にシャトルバスが運行されていた時期があった。
sen.e: At present, no bus service is available in front of Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, but in the past, a bus terminal for Ohara was placed in front of the Yae ammusement park, assuming an increase of users, with shuttle buses operated between this terminal and Ohara.

Currently, no bus service is available in front of Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, but in the past there was a bus terminal for Ohara in front of the Yae amusement park, assuming an increase of users, with shuttle buses operated between this terminal and Ohara.

Currently, no bus service is available in front of Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, but in the past there was a bus terminal for Ohara in front of the Yase amusement park, assuming an increase of users, with shuttle buses operated between this terminal and Ohara.

sen.j: 駅前すぐにある、会員制ホテル「エクシブ八瀬離宮」の入口前の階段は、バスターミナル整備当時にターミナルに上がるために作られたもので、そのすぐ上にターミナルがあった。
sen.e: The stair in front of the entrance to the Resourttrust XIV Yase Rikyu membership hotel, placed immediately in front of the station, was constructed to reach the bus terminal when the bus terminal was established, because the terminal was located at a higher place.

The stairway in front of the entrance to the Resourttrust XIV Yase Rikyu membership hotel, located immediately in front of the station, was constructed to reach the bus terminal when the bus terminal was established, because the terminal was located at a higher place.

The stairway in front of the entrance to the Resourttrust XIV Yase Rikyu membership hotel, located immediately in front of the station, was constructed to reach the bus terminal when the bus terminal was established, because the terminal was located at a higher place.

sen.j: 現在でも改札前の路上に「←大原方面」と書かれたかつてのバスターミナルへの誘導表示が、少し不明瞭になりながらも残っている。
sen.e: Even now, a sign for the bus terminal, "← For Ohara," still remins, though becoming slightly unlear.
Even today a sign for the bus terminal, "← For Ohara," remains, though it has faded somewhat.
Even today a sign for the bus terminal, '← For Ohara,' remains, though it has faded somewhat.

sen.j: 最寄バス停：京都バス八瀬駅前
sen.e: The nearest bus stop: Yase Station-mae (in front of Yase Station) for buses of Kyoto Bus
The nearest bus stop: Yase Station-mae (in front of Yase Station) for buses of Kyoto Bus
The nearest bus stop: Yase Eki-mae (in front of Yase Station) for buses of Kyoto Bus

sen.j: 八瀬駅前
sen.e: Yase Station-mae (infront of Yase Station)
Yase Station-mae (in front of Yase Station)
Yase Eki-mae (in front of Yase Station)

sen.j: バスのりばは駅前ではなく、駅から徒歩2分の国道367号沿いにある。
sen.e: The bus stop is not located in front of the station but along national highway 367, two minutes from the station on foot.
The bus stop isn't located in front of the station but along National Highway 367, a two-minute walk from the station.
The bus stop isn't located in front of the station but along National Route 367, a two-minute walk from the station.
sen.cmt: 国道→National Route としました。

sen.j: 京都バス
sen.e: Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）9月27日 京都電燈の八瀬駅として開業。
sen.e: September 27, 1925: This station started its operation as Yase Station of the Kyoto electric power company.
September 27, 1925: This station started its operation as Yase Station of the Kyoto Electric Power Company.
September 27, 1925: This station started its operation as Yase Station of the Kyoto Dento, an electric power company.
sen.cmt: Kyoto Dento, an electric power company としました。

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 会社譲渡により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: March 2, 1942: Because the company was handed over to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd, it became a station of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
March 2, 1942: Because the company was handed over to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., it became a station of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
March 2, 1942: Because the company was handed over to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., it became a station of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 1965年（昭和40年）8月1日 八瀬遊園駅と改称。
sen.e: August 1, 1965: The name was changed to Yase-yuen Station (the Yase amusement park station).
August 1, 1965: The name was changed to Yase-yuen Station (the Yase amusement park station).
August 1, 1965: The name was changed to Yase-yuen Station (the Yase amusement park station).

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社譲渡により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1986: Because the company was handed over to Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway), it became a station of Eizan-dentetsu.
April 1, 1986: Because the company was handed over to Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway), it became a station of Eizan-dentetsu.
April 1, 1986: Because the company was handed over to Eizan Electric Railway, it became a station of Eizan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: Eizan Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 2002年（平成14年）3月10日 八瀬比叡山口駅と改称。
sen.e: March 10, 2002: The name was changed to Yase-Hieizanguchi Station.
March 10, 2002: The name was changed to Yase-Hieizanguchi Station.
March 10, 2002: The name was changed to Yase-Hieizanguchi Station.

sen.e: Neighboring stations
Neighboring stations
